name: Saves the Day
description:
'''Saves the Day''' is an American [[Rock music|rock]] band formed in 1997 in [[Princeton, New Jersey]]. The band currently consists of lead vocalist and guitarist [[Chris Conley (musician)|Chris Conley]], guitarist Arun Bali, bassist Rodrigo Palma, and drummer Claudio Rivera.

After forming under the name '''Sefler''' in 1994, Saves the Day released their debut studio album, ''[[Can't Slow Down (Saves the Day album)|Can't Slow Down]]'', through [[Equal Vision Records]] in 1998. It was followed by ''[[Through Being Cool]]'' (1999), which featured their first single, "Shoulder to the Wheel". The band achieved mainstream success with the release of ''[[Stay What You Are]]'' (2001), released through [[Vagrant Records]], which sold 200,000 copies and spawned the [[MTV2]] hit singles <nowiki>''</nowiki>At Your Funeral" and "Freakish". The album's success allowed the band to sign to the major label [[DreamWorks Records]], who released the band's fourth album ''[[In Reverie]]'' (2003). DreamWorks folded into [[Interscope Records]], who dropped the band weeks after the album's release. The band have since released five more albums under the Vagrant, [[Razor & Tie]] and Equal Vision labels, with their most recent, ''[[9 (Saves the Day album)|9]]'', being released on October 26, 2018.
